name: Controller AI Workbench - Brand Commands
description: Scaffolding commands for creating brand-compliant prototypes based on extracted patterns

commands.name: scaffold-brand-prototype
commands.description: Create a new prototype with full Controller AI Workbench branding and architecture
commands.template:
Create a new Next.js 14 prototype with the following brand-compliant structure:

1. **Project Setup:**
   - Next.js 14 with App Router
   - TypeScript with strict mode
   - Tailwind CSS with brand tokens
   - shadcn/ui components
   - Brand component library

2. **Required Files:**
   - Copy `branding/` directory with all brand assets
   - Copy `tailwind.config.ts` with brand colors
   - Copy `app/globals.css` with premium styles
   - Setup `.cursor/rules.md` for brand enforcement

3. **Directory Structure:**
```
app/                 # Next.js App Router
components/
├── ui/             # shadcn/ui base
├── shared/         # Reusable utilities
└── [feature]/      # Feature-specific
branding/
├── ui/             # Brand components
├── brand-tokens.json
└── writing-style.md
lib/
├── types/          # TypeScript definitions
├── data/           # Data layer
└── utils.ts
```

4. **Dependencies:**
```json
{
  "next": "^14.2.0",
  "react": "^18.3.0",
  "typescript": "^5.3.0",
  "tailwindcss": "^3.4.1",
  "@radix-ui/react-*": "latest",
  "lucide-react": "latest",
  "recharts": "^2.12.0",
  "framer-motion": "^11.0.5",
  "zustand": "^4.5.1"
}
```

5. **Brand Integration:**
   - Import and use `BrandHeader` component
   - Apply Accenture purple theme (#8b5cf6)
   - Use premium card styling
   - Include AI agent indicators
   - Follow writing style guidelines

commands.name: enforce-writing-style
commands.description: Update text content to follow Controller AI Workbench writing style guidelines
commands.template:
Update content to match brand voice and tone: 1. **Terminology Updates:** ```tsx // ❌ Before (generic/incorrect terms) "Record to Report" → "Record-to-Report (R2R)" "JEs" or "journal postings" → "Journal entries" "Period close" → "Month-end close" "COA" → "Chart of Accounts" "GL" → "General Ledger" "AI-driven" → "AI-powered" "bot" or "AI assistant" → "Agent" "Awaiting Approval" → "Pending Approval" "Processing" → "In Progress" "Done" or "Finished" → "Completed" "Green" or "Good" → "On Track" // ✅ After (brand-compliant terms)

Controller AI Workbench

AI-Powered R2R Platform

Journal entries pending approval
Month-end close: Day 3 of 5, On Track
``` 2. **Page Title Format:** ```tsx // Pattern: [Functional Area] - [Brief Description] Journal Entries - Manage journal entries Cash & Treasury - Cash management Balance Sheet - BS reconciliations External Reporting - 10-K, 10-Q filings ``` 3. **Status Communication Pattern:** ```tsx // Pattern: [Progress] + [Timeline] + [Status Indicator] "75% complete, Day 3 of 5, On Track ✓" "12 items pending review, Due EOD" "3 critical items requiring attention" "Reconciliation complete ✓ Auto-matched 92%" ``` 4. **AI Process Descriptions:** ```tsx // Pattern: "How AI [Action] [Object/Process]" "How AI Forecasts Cash Position" "How AI Calculates Stock Compensation Expense" "How AI Sequences Close Tasks & Manages Dependencies" "How AI Matches Intercompany Transactions" "How AI Generates Variance Commentary" ``` 5. **Action-Oriented Language:** ```tsx // Use action verbs and clear CTAs // not "View Entries" // not "Finish Task" // not "Submit Journal" // not "Accept Transaction" ``` 6. **Professional Tone Guidelines:** - Use precise financial terminology - Maintain authoritative yet approachable voice - Focus on outcomes and actions - Show AI transparency without overwhelming - Organize information clearly with hierarchy
